data.text: Keeping the Foot Dry on Long-Distance Bicycle Tours

After 6 days of nice weather I got two days with a lot of rain. Big challenge to keep the shoes and feet dry. How do you keep your feet dry. I use the combination one pair of shoes, one pair of sandals and two pairs of merino wool socks. I wonder if there are any better alternatives?
Waterproof socks such as Sealskinz are good in wet conditions, especially when used with overshoes
data.author: Ian Hallett

data.text: I've used sealskinz (their gloves are also a miracle), have crappy circulation at my extremities and they keep my feet dry and cosy, even in pretty grim weather.
